skill.name: ghe-report
skill.description: Generate detailed reports with metrics, health checks, or epic-specific analysis. Report types: metrics (throughput, cycle times, first-pass rates), health (compliance status, stale threads, violation history), and epic (thread history, progress, decisions).
skill.summary: Generate detailed reports with metrics, health checks, or epic-specific analysis. Report types: metr...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. All 31 static findings are false positives. The skill contains only markdown documentation defining report formats and JSON metadata. No actual cryptographic operations, shell commands, or security risks are present.

content.user_title: Generate detailed workflow reports with metrics and analysis
content.value_statement: Struggling to track project performance and workflow health? This skill generates comprehensive reports with throughput metrics, compliance checks, and epic-specific analysis.
actual_capabilities: Generate metrics reports with throughput and cycle time statistics
Create health reports with compliance status and stale thread detection
Produce epic reports with thread history and progress tracking
Post reports to both GitHub Issues and local GHE_REPORTS directory
Respect local settings for notification level and stale thresholds
limitations: Cannot modify workflow state or transition issue phases
Read-only access to GitHub data for report generation
Requires existing GitHub Elements workflow setup
Does not provide real-time data updates

use_cases.title: Track team performance metrics
use_cases.description: Monitor throughput, cycle times, and quality metrics like first-pass review rates across development phases.

use_cases.title: Assess workflow compliance
use_cases.description: Identify stale threads, rule violations, and memory bank synchronization issues with health reports.

use_cases.title: Review epic progress details
use_cases.description: Get detailed status on specific epics including thread history, key decisions, and remaining work estimates.

prompt_templates.title: Performance overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me workflow metrics with throughput and cycle times

prompt_templates.title: Compliance check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a health check and identify any stale threads or violations

prompt_templates.title: Epic deep dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a detailed report on the authentication epic with thread history

prompt_templates.title: Quality metrics
prompt_templates.prompt: What is our first-pass review rate and demotion rate this month

output: Throughput: 12 features completed this week, up 3 from last week
Cycle times: DEV averages 4.2 sessions, TEST 2.1 sessions, REVIEW 3.5 sessions
Quality: 68% first-pass review rate, 12% demotion rate

output_examples.input: Run a health check on our workflow
output: Compliance: Phase order rules PASS, checkpoint frequency WARNING
Stale threads: 2 threads with no activity over 24 hours
Overall health: WARNINGS - attention needed on stale threads

best_practices: Use ghe-report for detailed analysis and ghe-status for quick overviews
Specify the report type (metrics, health, or epic) for focused results
Post reports to both GitHub Issues and GHE_REPORTS directory for persistence
anti_patterns: Using ghe-report when you only need a quick status check
Requesting workflow transitions within report generation prompts
Expecting reports to modify issue state or phase transitions

faq.question: What report types are available?
faq.answer: Three types: metrics (performance stats), health (compliance checks), and epic (specific project details).

faq.question: How is ghe-report different from ghe-status?
faq.answer: ghe-status gives quick current-state overviews. ghe-report provides detailed analysis with trends and metrics.

faq.question: Where are reports stored?
faq.answer: Reports are posted to GitHub Issue Threads and saved in GHE_REPORTS directory with timestamps.

faq.question: Can I customize report detail level?
faq.answer: Yes. Configure notification_level and stale_threshold_hours in .claude/ghe.local.md settings.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my workflow?
faq.answer: No. This skill is read-only for GitHub data and only writes generated reports to specified locations.

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through standard skill invocation.
